meanings.definition: The application of the principles of the natural sciences, especially biology and physiology, to clinical medicine.
meanings.sent1: Studying biomedicine helps doctors understand how the body works.
meanings.sent2: Biomedicine plays a crucial role in developing new treatments for diseases.
meanings.sent3: The quirky scientist loved experimenting with biomedicine in his backyard lab.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of biomedicine was a powerful tool in diagnosing illnesses.
meanings.sent5: Learning about biomedicine is like unlocking the secrets of the human body.

meanings.definition: The branch of medical science that deals with the ability of the body to cope with the stresses of disease.
meanings.sent1: Biomedicine focuses on how the body fights off illnesses.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use biomedicine to understand how diseases affect the body.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his body's biomedicine was top-notch after eating a whole cake.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against sickness, biomedicine is the body's greatest ally.
meanings.sent5: The concept of biomedicine is like the body's own superhero fighting off diseases.
